DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of breast surgery that was carried through to completion.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Data from an original source is not present, accessible or ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove abnormal tissue or cancer from the breast and a small amount of normal tissue around it. It is a type of breast-sparing surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.
